text: Edwin H. Land (1909 - 1991) was an American physicist and inventor. In 1932, he discovered a cheap and easy way to polarize light. In 1937 he set up the Polaroid Corporation to make scientific instruments and anti-glare sunglasses. In 1947 he developed the Polaroid camera. It could print photographs without needing film. ==References== Category:1909 births Category:1991 deaths Category:American physicists Category:Scientists from Connecticut
